text: Hi YouTube! You look nice! It's been a while...
Is that a new haircut you got? ...I like it.
Um...Where have we been? We have not be cancelled...despite some interesting rumors
I've noticed in the comment section of the "Shoes" episode. The Brain Scoop is not cancelled.
In fact, we're going to have a new episode for you tomorrow--this doesn't count, this is just me sitting in my office
...and babbling on...
I wanted to give you guys some updates on what we're working on, so...
#1. Episode tomorrow. So stay tuned for that.
#2. We got so many good, thoughtful responses to the survey that we issued at the end of last year,
so thank you to everybody who took the time to respond.
We did some soul-searching, after reading through all of those responses and we've decided
to change the way that we're making content, a little bit.
We want to experiment with longer content.
We want to do more involved videos.
So that's one of the big things that we've been working on.
A multi-interview, multi-part, bigger picture kind of video that has a dissection in it.
So, that's exciting for those of you
that like the blood and guts. For those that don't, we will have the Grossometer in there so don't worry.
That video will be out in a couple of weeks, it just takes a lot of work to put it all together.
But I'm really, really, really excited about it.
Also based off the feedback in the survey,
we decided to take a harder look at Natural News from the Field Museum
and tried to figure out what it is we're actually trying to do.
We're trying to share science news stories from this institution
and trying to do it in a way that helps people understand that museums are places of activity
...and we know that.
I think there's a better way that we can go about sharing a lot of those stories and messages.
So we're going to experiment with a podcast instead and see if that works out.
Hopefully, it will.
...and you can know--when we launch--that, because we're also starting a newsletter.
So if you want email updates from us, when we have new content, new videos, or the podcast, or new
merchandise, or interesting links to cool science articles, then you should click on the link in the video description
and you can sign up for our newsletter.
What else?
I think, maybe, that was everything.
I have a hard time focusing for long periods of time. It's already been 2 minutes, 27 seconds.
Okay, I think that was all.
We have an episode tomorrow. We're working on longer episodes, and you should sign up for our newsletter.
Okay, I think that was everything.
I love you!
[whispering] ...it still has brains on it...
